text: Ernest William Gibson Jr. (March 6, 1901 â€“ November 4, 1969) was an American politician, lawyer and judge. From 1940 to 1941, he was made United States Senator after the death of his father Ernest Willard Gibson. From 1947 to 1950, he was Governor of Vermont. In 1949, President Harry S. Truman made him Judge of the United States District Court for the District of Vermont. Gibson died in Brattleboro, Vermont on November 4, 1969 at the age of 68. ==References== Category:1901 births Category:1969 deaths Category:United States senators from Vermont Category:Governors of Vermont Category:American judges Category:Lawyers from Vermont Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:People from Brattleboro, Vermont Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Military people from Vermont
title: Ernest W. Gibson Jr.
